## Introduction

This section covers the foundational concepts you need to understand how generative AI works and how to use it effectively.

## Topics

### [How LLMs Work](how-llms-work.qmd)

Understand the core mechanics behind Large Language Models:

- Transformer architecture basics
- Training and fine-tuning processes
- Tokens and tokenization
- Context windows and attention

### [Key GenAI Capabilities](key-capabilities.qmd)

Explore what modern GenAI systems can do:

- Text generation and summarization
- Code generation and assistance
- Analysis and reasoning
- Creative applications
- Multimodal capabilities

### [Choosing the Right Tool](choosing-tools.qmd)

Learn to evaluate and select appropriate tools:

- Matching capabilities to use cases
- Cost considerations
- Privacy and security factors
- Integration requirements

## Why Fundamentals Matter

::: {.callout-tip}
## Building Strong Foundations
Understanding how these systems work — even at a high level — enables you to:

- Write better prompts
- Anticipate limitations
- Troubleshoot unexpected outputs
- Make informed tool choices
:::

## Recommended Path

1. Start with **How LLMs Work** to build foundational understanding
2. Move to **Key Capabilities** to see what's possible
3. Finish with **Choosing the Right Tool** to apply your knowledge

Each section builds on the previous one, so we recommend following this order.
